intro: Ledebouria confusa, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a species of bulbous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces a cluster of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a rosette near the ground. It is often grown in rock gardens or as a container plant due to its compact size and ornamental appeal. Ledebouria confusa is adapted to dry, well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
